SALESFORCE HELP

VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11) Release Notes

Streamline your brand's ecommerce experience with new resources for unifying your Experience Cloud site, boosting discovery of your storefront, and analyzing user traffic. Continue to deliver incremental performance improvements and reinforce the integrity of your storefront and user data. Further customize and fine-tune your storefront's user experience.

Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) introduces changes that affect the Product List page, Checkout page, and your storefront's Experience Cloud site. These changes can disrupt your existing storefront after you upgrade the managed package. To resolve these changes in your B2B Commerce solution and keep your storefront working correctly, complete the following upgrade steps.
Lightning Components for B2B Commerce for Visualforce: Create Storefront Entry Points with Experience Builder
Add commerce capabilities to your Experience Builder site with Lightning components for B2B Commerce for Visualforce. These components show data from a B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront directly on your Experience Builder site. The components also link to pages on your Visualforce storefront, which helps provide a smooth user experience between your storefront and your Experience Builder site.
Google Analytics: Easily Track Storefront Activity
Using clicks, not code, you can easily track storefront activity. Connect a Google Analytics 4 (GA4) account to your B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefronts, and easily view, measure, and analyze your storefront activity from your Google Analytics console.
Reorder Widget: Give Buyers a Shortcut for Repeating a Previous Order
Give buyers a shortcut for quickly placing a new order based on a previous order. When you enable the Reorder widget for your storefront, a buyer can see up to three of their most recent orders at a glance. With a single click, the buyer can start a new shopping cart based on one of those recent orders.
SEO: Enhance Your Global Search Strategy
Align your storefront with more search engine guidelines, further reduce content cloaking, and include more search-optimized data with only a few clicks. Add visibility for all the locales your storefront supports, and let search engine bots easily crawl and index locale-specific content. Serve more semantic content directly to search engine bots, or customize the bot-enabled pages to suit your specific requirements.
Coupons: Easily Extend Default Coupon Behavior
Gain precise control over how coupons are applied on your storefront, including which users can use coupons and when they can apply coupons. The B2B Commerce for Visualforce API includes new methods and logic classes that you can extend or override. With this change, you can more easily customize the logic that's evaluated before or after a coupon is applied.
Order Review 2.0: Deliver a Faster Standard Checkout Experience
Version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page is optimized to improve performance for the standard checkout flow. Version 2.0 provides the same user experience as version 1.0, but has faster data retrieval and quicker response times.
Performance and Security: Improve Discovery and Elevate Trust
Reinforce the trust that your buyers have in your storefront, and deliver incremental performance gains across your storefront. Take advantage of improvements in how B2B Commerce for Visualforce loads data for certain pages and widgets.
Promotions: Provide Consistent Experiences Across Devices
Promote your products across all user experiences, no matter which device screen size your buyers are using. When you create promotions for a Bootstrap 3 storefront, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now shows the promotions on any screen size.
Address Picklists: Easily Specify a Single Country or State Value
To allow only one country, territory, or state in address picklists on your storefront, you can now easily specify the single value allowed. You can create page labels that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references when showing the country, territory, or state. If you localize your storefront, create localized page label records to easily provide translated country, territory, or state names.
Other Fixes in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
Have confidence that the issues related to performance or buyer experience that you've reported are resolved appropriately. This release includes several fixes that resulted from your submitted cases.
Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11)
Several patch releases are available for maintaining existing implementations of B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11). Some patches contain fixes that require manual upgrade steps. Each patch release is also cumulative, and contains all the fixes from previous B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) patches. When you install a particular patch build, complete any required upgrade steps for all patches that precede the patch you're installing.

title: Upgrading B2B Commerce for Visualforce
